alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:19PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow will impact Upper and Lower Lake Mary and Mormon Lakes through 645 PM MST... At 617 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dairy Springs Campground to near Happy Jack to near Starlight Pines. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gust up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Dairy Springs Campground, Stoneman Lake, Mormon Lake, Munds Park, Junipine Resort, Clints Well, Garland`s Oak Creek Lodge, Happy Jack, Slide Rock State Park, Mountainaire, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Upper Lake Mary, Clints Well Campground, West Fork Of Oak Creek, Pine Flat Campground, Blue Ridge Campground, Ashurst Lake Campgrounds, Rock Crossing Campground and Pinegrove Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Upper Lake Mary, Lower Lake Mary, or Mormon Lake...get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Little to no rain or thunder will accompany the gusty outflow. Get to safe harbor now if on Upper Lake Mary, Lower Lake Mary or Mormon Lake.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
